53.text: The tenements are located in the Ashburton region (West Pilbara Mineral Field) of

54.text: Western Australia.  The tenements are centred about 170km WNW of Paraburdoo

55.text: with  the  sealed  Nanutarra-Paraburdoo  Highway  passing  through  the  De  Courcy

56.text: portion  of  the  tenement  package  (Figure  3).    Access  within  the  tenements  is  by

text:
to the north and north west of Paulsens which have prospectivity for Channel Iron 
 Deposits as well as gold and base metals. 
 Historical gold production in the region has come from small, high-grade vein quartz 
 and  placer  deposits,  but  the  discovery  of  Carlin-style  gold  mineralization  at  Mt 
 Olympus and of epithermal gold-silver at Mt Clement in the 1980’s and 1990’s, has 
 indicated the potential of the region to host a major gold deposit.  In addition, the 
 discovery  by  Taipan  at  Paulsens  in  1999  (~600,000  ozs  in  resources)  also 
 underlines the prospectivity of the near Wyloo Dome setting. 
 Exploration  by  Cullen  since  1997  in  the  region  has  included  programmes  of 
 mapping,  soil,  rock chip  and  stream  sampling, review  of  previous  exploration,  and 
 interpretation of aeromagnetics and radiometrics.  In previous years, the progress of 
 exploration  has  been  reported  separately  for  various  portions  of  the  tenement 
 package  including: the De Courcy  Project area, the  Hardey  Junction  Project area, 
 the Yanks Bore Project area and the Slate Bore Project area. 
 Throughout 2003, a portion of Cullen’s package was the subject of a Joint Venture 
 with Barrick Australia (the Wyloo Joint Venture), which was terminated towards the 
 end of that year and management of the tenements returned to Cullen. 
 API  Management  Pty  Ltd  (a  50:50  JV  between  AMCI  Holdings  and  Aquila 
 Resources  Limited)  joined  Cullen  to  explore  for  iron  ore  deposits  over  tenements 
 E08/1330, E1341, E1135, E1292 and E1375 in 2004. 
 The focus of on-going exploration at this time is iron ore exploration. 
 LOCATION AND ACCESS 
 The tenements are located in the Ashburton region (West Pilbara Mineral Field) of 
 Western Australia.  The tenements are centred about 170km WNW of Paraburdoo 
 with  the  sealed  Nanutarra-Paraburdoo  Highway  passing  through  the  De  Courcy 
 portion  of  the  tenement  package  (Figure  3).    Access  within  the  tenements  is  by 
 station tracks and along fencelines.  
 3

text:
In 2004/2005, the Lizzie gold prospect, located within the now surrendered E47/874, 
 was  the  focus  of  exploration,  with  a  total  of  16  shallow  RC  drill  holes  completed.  
 These holes targeted several major stratabound quartz blows that coincide with the 
 highest values of the soil anomaly. The assay results from the five metre composite 
 samples  collected  (analysed  at  Genalysis  for  Au  to  1ppb  [B/ETA  method])  were 
 generally  disappointing  with  a  best  intersection  of  5m  @  0.157  g/t  Au  (Ringrose 
 Also in 2004/2005, Joint Venture managers API Management Pty Ltd commenced 
 their iron ore exploration and completed a field mapping and sampling program over 
 E08/1330, E1135 and E1341, as reported in the Annual Report for 2005 (Ringrose, 
 In 2005/2006, Joint Venture managers API Management Pty Ltd extended their work 
 and completed extensive programmes of RC drilling within E08/1341 and E08/1330 
 and  other  programs  directed  towards  the  delineation  of  Channel  Iron  Deposits  as 
 reported  in  the  Annual  Report  for  2006.  Cullen  commissioned  Peter  Wilson  of 
 International  Earthscan  to  compile  and  interpret  satellite  imagery  for  the  remote 
 Horse Well tenement area (E47/1154 – now part of a separate report group), with a 
 view to identifying key areas for iron ore exploration focused on the Marra Mamba 
 and Brockman bedded iron ore formations (Ringrose, 2006 - ASH/DC/06/1).  
 EXPLORATION COMPLETED IN 2006/2007 
 5.1  Gold and Base Metal Exploration 
 Cullen and Red Hill Iron Limited signed a Joint Venture Agreement in March 2007 
 concerning  tenements  E08/1135,  1330,  1341,  1292,  1375  and  1622,  which  are 
 contiguous  with  Red  Hill’s  major  Project  Area  in  the  NW  of  the  Ashburton  Basin 
 (Figure  1).  The  JV  excludes  the  iron  ore  rights,  which  remain  the  subject  of  a 
 separate  joint  venture  between  Cullen  and  API.  Red  Hill  can  earn  its  equity  with 
 expenditure of $1M over a four year period with a minimum of $200,000 in the first 
 year. The results of Red Hill’s preliminary work between March  and August 2007, 
 are included here as Appendix 2. 
 5

19.text: the past year and in May 2007, an Initial Resource Estimate of 68Mt @ 55.38% Fe

20.text: was released for the Catho Well Channel iron Deposit.  Also, in March 2007, Cullen

21.text: farmed out the base metal and gold rights to Red Hill Iron Limited, with exploration

22.text: for these commodities at an early stage.

text:
the past year and in May 2007, an Initial Resource Estimate of 68Mt @ 55.38% Fe 
 was released for the Catho Well Channel iron Deposit.  Also, in March 2007, Cullen 
 farmed out the base metal and gold rights to Red Hill Iron Limited, with exploration 
 for these commodities at an early stage.
